New Records: Dominik Szoboszlai scored a brace, his 14th goal in his 49th game for Hungary
Key Match Events: Hungary was awarded a penalty after a favourable call by English referee Anthony Taylor
Edin Džeko had a couple of shots on goal, but was stopped both times by the Hungarian goalie Dénes Dibusz
Pre-Game Insights: Hungary had an unexpected tie against the Euro 2024 semi-finalists Netherlands (1–1 at home)
The Bosnians are Hungary’s biggest rivals in the relegation clash in League A of the UEFA Nations League
Post-Match Reflections: With this victory, the national team will most likely avoid direct relegation this season, and will have the chance to play a play-off at the end of the season to stay in the top division
Miscellaneous Highlights: Hungary are now sitting tied on points with the Netherlands in second and third place
Hungary will play their re-match in Amsterdam, Netherlands on 16 November
Hungary’s last game in the group stage of this Nations League season will be played on 19 November at the Puskás Arena in Budapest, Hungary against Germany
